column4: Despite doiing sudo  dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg i am still getting the error.
Anyone have any ideas?
only 1 graphics card?
YEs
I have onboard but they are off by auto if a PCI-E is inserted. Which it is.
I am assuming my problem lies with my graphics card?
what is your graphics card?
I have an x800 PCI-E
(ATI)
what driver are you using?
On what? Ubuntu?
Or on Windows?
Ubuntu
I havn't installed a driver yet... I haven't been able to get on to install one.
dpk-reconfigure xserver-xorg would have specified a driver, do you remember what it was?
No I shall do it again
at a guess it is probably guessing the wrong one
It picked it up as an x800
can you pastebin your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file?
If I can access it...
what driver is reconfigure suggesting?
One moment
X server driver: the selected one is ATI
Which it what it is so I press OK
as a test i would change that to 'vesa'
Then it identifies it as ATI TECHNOLOGIES, Inc. R423 UK [Radeon x800SE (PCI-E)]
Pholsten I will select that. For the rest of the reconfigure do I leave it as the default entries?
yeah, should be fine to leave defaults
every card should work with vesa, except the performance will suck, but it will confirm whether it is driver or not
Another Fatal error. Although it did come up with some pixels at the top of the screen then they quickly disappeared.

The fatal error reads: Could not open default font 'fixed' XIO fatal error 104 (connection reset by peer) on X server :0.0 after 0 resquests (0known processed) with 0 events remaining. xauth: error in locking authority file /home/aidan/.Xauthority
what ubuntu version is this?
6.10 - (Alternate download) as I had major problems with the main normal download.
yes, i am fairly sure your card isnt supported by the included ATI driver
O
I see... Ubuntu 5.1 worked ok. Although that had to be uninstalled as my wireless adaptor wasn't compatible. So... Where do I go from here do you think?
sounds like you may want to do some manual tweaking of your xorg.conf file
How do I access that... I hate to sound thick...
a bit hard when you dont have a desktop
you have a terminal prompt open?
Yeah it is on screen now.
type 'sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf'
Command not found.
that is what I am getting. I am probably doing something wrong...
try just 'nano'
- nano: command not found
ok, you dont have nano, its a text editor
I see...
which is odd, as it is a default installed package
It failed on the installing software bit. Perhaps that would explain it... :$
ah right, that might explain the font error too, it might be missing something
try running this 'sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop'
Pholsten Will do. By the way I really do appriciate the help :)
ubuntu-desktop is a meta package that will instead all the base ubuntu install, so if you are missing something it should fix it up
I will inform once it is done. It is 10% now lol.
haha, its missing a few bits then ;)
It has finished. Although Failed to fetch cdrom: [Ubuntu 6.10 _edgy eft_ release 1386 (20061025.1] /pool/main/g/gcj-41/libgcj7-0_4.1.1-14ubunutu7_1386.deb MD5Sum mismatch
sounds like your cd might have had a problem
